text: Brilliant headline: "The Genesis of ‘Jexodus’ " story via @sherylNYT
author: kseelye

text: In the world of high-priced college consultants, $10 million is “an entry-level gift that might not even get the attention of the admission office.” via @DanaGoldstein & @jackhealyNYT
author: kseelye

text: A refreshing take on what Dems can expect in Milwaukee in 2020, thanks to Wisconsin tour guide @juliebosman. But what even *is* a frozen custard?
author: kseelye

text: Trump says making daylight saving time permanent is ‘OK with me’ https://www.bostonglobe.com/news/politics/2019/03/11/trump-says-making-daylight-saving-time-permanent-with/c65RNNv0BruHCxRR9dnizJ/story.html?event=event25 … via @BostonGlobe

text: #MaPoli #BosPoli
author: kseelye

text: To be clear, I, @kseelye, wasn’t the one “beaten beyond recognition”… That was Emma Gatewood, one of the bravest hikers of the AT.
author: kseelye

text: NAACP to hold its 2020 convention in Boston, for the first time since 1982. Boston officials say this is a sign they are addressing the city's racial inequities. via @gintautasd https://www.bizjournals.com/boston/news/2019/03/11/boston-to-host-naacp-convention-in-2020.html … via @BosBizJournal
author: kseelye

text: More than 1,400 US towns have lost their newspaper over the last 15 years. ”While national outlets worry about a president who calls the press an enemy of the people, many Americans have no one watching city council.”
author: kseelye

text: It's time for time to be left alone. “Most people don’t even understand whether moving the clocks forward gives them more sunlight or less sunlight in the morning. They just can’t remember what it does, because it so defies logic." Via @kljohnso
author: kseelye

text: ⁦@carolynryan⁩ Wait a minute! I think they mixed up our orders.
author: kseelye

text: And it’s not just rural nursing homes that are in trouble. Check out the #Codcast ⁦@BruceMohl⁩
author: kseelye

text: More than 440 rural nursing homes have closed or merged over the last decade, scattering patients like seeds in the wind. Many end up far from their families. Great on-ground reporting by @jackhealyNYT.
author: kseelye

text: Jean Fairfax, unsung shero who helped black families integrate schools in the South, dies at 98 via @kseelye @NYTimes
author: kseelye

text: An honor to learn about unsung shero #JeanFairfax and how little #DebraLewis put her hand in hers and said “I’m ready go,” to integrate her school in Mississippi in 1964. @kseelye
author: kseelye

text: Chicago votes today for a new mayor, who will oversee a city with a mess o' problems, including an exodus by black residents. @monicadavey1 explains
author: kseelye

text: Black History Trail Makes 200 Stops Across Massachusetts   via @kseelye ⁦@nytimes⁩
author: kseelye

text:
Mapping 200 historic African-American sites across Massachusetts, from slavery to Black Lives Matter via @kseelye
#mapoli #bospoli https://www.nytimes.com/2019/02/21/arts/design/black-history-african-american-trail-project-boston.html …
author: kseelye

text: Excellent news: @carolrosenberg, THE walking encyclopedia of all things Gitmo, is coming to the NYT. We first met at Gitmo after 9/11. I eventually left, she’s been there ever since.
author: kseelye

text: While it is highly unusual for anyone — let alone the president — to comment on continuing criminal investigations, Trump has done so more than 43 percent of his time in office. Check out this NYT time line.
author: kseelye

text: Maine taxpayers paid for ex Gov.  #LePage, staff to stay at Trump hotel in DC, for up to $1,100/night. Now part of fed lawsuit showing Trump’s business conflicts. @thisdog Portland Press Herald
author: kseelye
